Address: Revit Operator - Part or Full Time
column4:
We seek IMMEDIATE help with a skilled Revit user for documentation on a single-family house. This is a posting only for experienced Revit users.

Work can last as short as one month, full-time, with potential to transition to permanent full-time depending on performance. 

Applicants must demonstrate complete mastery of Revit, including the following tasks:
- General documentation;
- Building all types of families from scratch;
- Modeling of sophisticated geometries in a way that permits them to be documented.

While architecture experience is not a requirement, it is a benefit.

Please forward a resume and a PDF that includes past Revit work. Particularly attention will be given to applicants who can show construction documents from Revit.

Architectural Sheet Metal and Grille company looking

Employment type: full-time

Duties include but are not limited to preliminary review of bid packages, preparing proposals, take offs, analyzing drawings (blueprints), following up on RFIs, being a liaison between company and subcontractors, attend meetings and progress walk-throughs

Must have experience drafting in construction or other related field. 

MUST HAVE 2 years experience in the field, knowledge of construction software/ strong analytical and communication skills.
Must be detail oriented and possess good customer service skills. Must work well with others, have good work ethic, be self motivated and a team player.

Assistant Estimator 

The goal is to provide detailed take-offs to enable accurate estimates,

Responsibilities:

•	Prepare accurate estimates for concrete frame buildings including excavation, shoring and foundations.
•	Check specifications and submit RFI’s to Client.
•	Use estimating software as well as Excel for preparing take-offs off blueprints
•	Create and submit estimate reports or bids to Senior Estimator.
•	Obtain and review offers and quotes by subcontractors or vendors
•	Build relationships with key vendors (subcontractors, suppliers, GC's etc.)
•	Expedite submittals for architect approval
•	Provide consultation on planning (schedules, material lists, needs etc.)
•	Conduct research to obtain data on material costs, production times etc.
•	Understand the project/program and its requirements
•	Determine key variables for cost and other estimates
•	Assist Foreman/Project Manager in the project process to help make the project move smoothly and efficiently


Position Qualifications:

•	Must have experience with engineering and architectural drawings
•	In depth knowledge of research and data analysis methods and estimation formulas
•	Exquisite math and computer knowledge with an analytical mindset
•	Proficient in relevant software (Microsoft Excel, Estimating Software)


 We are a fast growing concrete contractor with opportunities for growth and we offer competitive salary and bonus system
•

Concrete Safety Manager 

Responsibilities
Conduct training and presentations for health and safety matters and accident prevention to workmen
•	Monitor compliance to policies and laws by inspecting employees, their certifications and operations
•	Inspect equipment and machinery to observe possible unsafe conditions
•	Investigate accidents or incidents and prepare reports.
•	Recommend solutions to issues, improvement opportunities or new prevention measure
•	Report on health and safety awareness, issues and statistics
•	Excellent organizational and motivational skills
•	Outstanding attention to detail and observation ability
•	Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities plus an ability to enforce rules.
•	Keep records and daily reports.

REQUIREMENTS

Proven experience as a concrete safety manager with NYC DOB registration  AND OSHA CERTIFICATION. 

Knowledge of FDNY regulations as they pertain to construction sites.
Deep understanding of legal health and safety guidelines and ability to enforce rules and regulations as required.

Ability in producing reports and developing relevant policies

Knowledge of standards and regulations for safeguarding and maintaining a construction site to ensure work is carried out in a safe manner.

Knowledge of the standards and regulations related to fall protection, types of protection and related safety equipment.

Knowledge of regulation related to Traffic Controls and Pedestrian Safety Knowledge of standards and regulations related to Fire Prevention.

Knowledge of Standards and regulations related to OSHA concrete Subpart Q.

Knowledge of standards and regulations related to the use of Cranes and Derricks as related to concrete operations.


We are a fast growing concrete construction company with room for advancement,  Competitive pay and opportunities for bonuses.

We are a successful Queens based Architectural Firm and are looking for an individual with 5 to 15 years of professional practice in an Architect’s office.
Our studio offers an opportunity to be involved in all phases of Project Development from Feasibility, Zoning and Building Code Analysis, to Design Development, Construction Documents, Consultant Coordination, Construction Administration and City Approvals to Project Close up.

You will be involved in a diverse array of project types including Commercial, Residential, Educational, Mixed-Use, New Buildings and Alterations. Our projects vary in size and complexity from Multi-Story new buildings to interior alterations. 
Requirements
• Professional degree in Architecture from an NAAB Accredited Program
• Minimum 5-10 years US experience in an architecture office
• Proven ability to produce Construction Documents
• Working knowledge of NYC code and zoning regulations
• Familiarity with DOB procedures 
• Perform Site visits 
• Check submittals and respond to requests for information
• Fluent in AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp 
• Fluent English
• Strong work ethic and ability to work with others  

Please submit your resume including work samples and limit to 5 MB.
This position offers excellent growth opportunity and a competitive salary.

Well-known architecture and interiors practice, seeks intermediate level staff (5+ years) to join its New York office. This person will be exposed to a range of work, including but not limited to: retail, corporate and hospitality projects. 

Will work on a team, but must be able to complete sections of work with a fair amount of autonomy, producing high quality design development drawings in Revit and CAD.

Interested parties should have 5+ years experience working in a professional architectural setting. Must be able to show a quality set of DD or CD drawings and have exposure to built projects.

Prime Architectural Woodworking Company in NYC looking for an ambitious, positive and long term oriented individual with a minimum 4 years experience as a Project Manager in an Architectural Woodworking Company.
Requirements: Excellent knowledge of technology and materials, work under pressure and high managerial skills. Ability to independently work on large commercial and residential projects. High work ethic and self motivation. Very good people skills. Only candidates from the trade please apply.
Please email your resume, references and salary expectations.

A reputable Architectural Woodworking Company is looking for a full time draftsman/assistant project manager position. Only solid, professional and long term oriented please apply. This position requires excellent knowledge of AUTOCAD. Only experienced in the field apply. Please email your resume, references and salary expectations

We are the seller of high-end window & doors for residential and commercial projects throughout the NY Metro/Northeast area.  Our sales office is located on the Upper East Side, with manufacturing operations located in numerous locations throughout Europe and South America. We sell various product lines, including thermally-broken steel, stainless steel, bronze and aluminum as well as wood (mahogany) and wood/aluminum clad.  All of our projects are custom made to order based on the customer’s needs.  

We are a small company that is growing quickly, and looking to find an entry level employee to help out and learn so they can eventually transition into a more important role.



-  Interpret architectural drawings to create a project takeoff to be sent to manufacturers for pricing
-  Find leads using verified techniques to feed the sales team




-  Salary, computer, expense reimbursement & health insurance
-  Role will eventually transition into a promotion to project management or sales




-  Strong knowledge of computers and software.  Programs will include Excel, Podio & basic PDF software.  Occasional use of an AutoCAD reader (no drafting).  We will teach each program to the right candidate, but experience in any of these is a plus.  

-  Strong attention to detail.  You will be reviewing documents with lots of information on them, so being able to pick up on patterns and spot irregularities is a must.

-  Ability to read architectural drawings a plus

-  Willing to learn:  we will train the right candidate over the first 6 months, but during this time you will also need to learn independently in your free time to get up to speed as quickly as possible.

-  Strong communication skills.  You will be collaborating with other engineers and will need to describe issues, resolutions, updates and requirements in a clear manner.

-  Bachelor’s degree in any technical field preferred, but not required.  A field relating to architecture, construction or engineering would be ideal.

-  Work experience in construction, architecture or engineering-related field preferred, but not required.

This is a full time position for an experienced Project Manager conducting inside sales for high-end commercial and residential floor covering, including carpeting and custom area rugs. Our showroom is in New York City near Union Square.

The successful candidate must posses a minimum of 5 years of experience working in high-end luxury sales, preferably working with architects, interior designers and general contractors.

Other qualifications and requirements are:
- understand urban commercial and residential living concepts, styles and designs.
- proof-of-success includes references for 3 successful completed projects.
- work in harmony with others in an open office environment.
- read and understand a floor plan at ease and not intimidated by complex numbers.
- excellent verbal and writing communication skills.

This is an ideal position for an architect, designer, general contractor who is interested in switching career path.

TO APPLY, please reply via email with your resume and cover letter files attached (pdf, docx, or doc). Please do not copy and paste your information in the body of the email. To be considered, please indicate "Project Manager" in the subject line. 
Please visit aronsonsfloors.com to learn more about us.

We have an immediate opening for a floor plan measurer. This is a flexible position for part-time work (contractor). You will set your own schedule and we will fit appointments into your availability (M-F, 9-5 only). 

Applicant must be highly experienced in creating as-built condition drawings (floor plans) of residential and commercial properties in CAD. Applicant must have the ability to create CAD drawings on-site using own laptop and AutoCAD software. Taking measurements on paper and later transferring to CAD drawings is NOT acceptable. Applicant must use a laser tape measure on-site.

Applicant must:
- Have a good understanding of building construction
- Be highly-proficient in CAD
- Have availability during normal weekday business hours: 9-5 to survey properties (please do not apply if you are looking for after-hour or weekend appointments.)
- Have own vehicle to visit properties
- Be reliable and very detail oriented

There are no set number of measurements in a day or week as appointments vary from week to week. We prefer a candidate with lots of availability but can set up as many or as few appointments as desired. This is a great, flexible opportunity for the right candidate.

Compensation: $50 per hr plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

Please send email with your previous work experience and education. 
You must use the following subject line in your email: "Re: Floor Plan Measurer - New York"

Senior Mechanical Design Engineer must create and launch six product prototypes and related commercial versions. Senior Mechanical Design Engineer must design an additional three prototypes using Autodesk Inventor, AutoCAD and Autodesk CFD for 3D modeling product design related tasks.
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer must optimize final manufacturing product costs by more than 25% by using python for SKU sizing optimization and use data modeling for ongoing optimization of product and processes. 
In the Research and Development phase of our business, Senior Mechanical Design Engineer oversees development of electrifying gas and oil boilers in NYC in partnership with National Grid & Columbia University. This will help to eliminate the use of fossil fuels for heating in the city and would improve air quality.  
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer performs ongoing modeling simulations of thermodynamic processes.
In the Product/Project Management phase of our business, Senior Mechanical Design Engineer manages relationships with manufacturers, and compiles functional and technical specifications including unique design specifications for various products. Senior Mechanical Design Engineer must also manage and review iterative feedback processes for manufacturing components.
Senior Mechanical Design Engineer oversees and provides technical advice for the installation of large projects including the full retrofit of Providence public housing and Providence public schools in partnership with National Grid.
Daily supervision of 2 subordinate Buildings Engineers; and 3 subcontractors.
Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering plus 1 year progressive postgraduate experience. Radiator Labs, Inc, New York City, NY. Resume to jobs@radiatorlabs.com

Mechanical Contractor specializing in HVAC construction, installation and maintenance for the NY Tri-State area is currently seeking a qualified candidate to fill the role of a Plan Clerk on a full time basis. The Plan Clerk will report directly to the Director of Estimating. The Plan Clerk will be responsible in receiving and reviewing documents in regards to estimating, managing electronically stored files and following up on document changes. The job is heavily dependent on computer usage, you will be responsible in obtaining, sorting all plan documents for the company.

Description:

Plan Clerk will receive and review all request for proposals from clients.
Work with estimators to develop and manage an estimating schedule.
Obtain pricing from vendors and suppliers and subcontractors.
Ensure the estimating team has up to date information.
Maintain, update, and organize all electronic files including hard copies.
Assist in the preparation of proposals and bid folders
Follow-up on bids and estimates
Responsible for obtaining drawings for bidding purposes.

Qualification:

Minimum 1 year experience in a construction company
Ability to multi-task, work in a fast pace environment.
Strong organization skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Should be well versed in computer usage and software such as Microsoft Office and Building Connected.

Our Company offers:

Medical / Dental / Vision
401(k)
Paid Time Off
Employee Stock Ownership Plan

Surveyor layout

Fast Growing Contractor in NY metropolitan area looking for a survey/layout man.
Work includes excavation, foundations, SOE, and concrete superstructures.

Responsibilities are as follows ( But Are Not Limited To)

•	Proficient in current surveying techniques using different types of total stations, data collectors, GPS Equipment and Robotic Instruments.
•	Ability to use surveying and CAD software.
•	Performs boundary, topographic, utilities surveying and construction stake out.
•	Holds level or stadia rod at designated points to assist in determining elevations and laying out stakes.
•	Calls out reading or writes station number and reading in notebook.
•	Marks points of measurement with elevation, station number, or other identifying mark.
•	Measures distance between survey points with steel tape, cloth tape or electronic instruments.
•	Marks measuring points with keel (marking crayon), paint sticks, scratches, tacks, or stakes.
•	Places stakes at designated points and drives them into ground at specified elevation.
•	Performs other duties as required.
•	Operates survey instruments virtually every day with little or no supervision, while striving to increase speed and accuracy.
•	Makes field book notes and sketches of data gathered at job site.
•	Prepares as-built drawings as required. 


Requirements

•	Bachelor's degree preferred but not required.
•	Minimum of 5 year of related experience.
•	Ability to use surveying and CAD software.
•	Experience with boundary, topographic, utilities surveying and construction stake out.
•	Carry layout up through superstructure floors.
•	Must have a valid New York or New Jersey Driver's License.
Excellent salary for right candidate with bonus opportunities. 
We are an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer.

Job Description:

We are currently seeking an inspector to join our team to perform special inspection on New York City construction projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:
- Review construction documents and shop drawings.
- Perform special inspection for residential and commercial buildings in New York City.
- Prepare reports on inspection activities, file documentation and complete required technical report forms in accordance with New York City Building Codes.
- Coordinate with owners, contractors, and engineers.

Skills and Qualifications:
- High School Diploma is required. Bachelor’s degree or higher is preferred.
- 3+ years of related work experience as a construction or special inspector.
- Holding and/or be able to obtain the required ICC certification within three months of hire.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Must be eligible to work in the United States

Job Description:

We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction.
- Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards.
- Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations.
- Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications
- Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives
- Review shop drawings, RFI's.
- Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Must be eligible to work in the United States

Entry Level Candidates:
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.

Intermediate Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.

Advance Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.
- NYS PE License

Seeking full time LICENSED or UNLICENSED, JUNIOR or SENIOR CONSTRUCTION ARCHITECT.
3 to 5+ years of architectural design, drafting, detailing & managing construction-related plans, drawings, documents for multifamily/mixed use projects, using AutoCAD, Revit and other tools.

URBAN ARCHITECTURE LLC is a small ‘design/build’ architectural & civil engineering firm in Jersey City, working in-house with MANHATTAN BUILDING COMPANY, private developer/ builder of award winning projects in Hudson County, NJ.
Continuing long term development, design, construction of mid/high rise luxury multifamily/ mixed use projects in historic neighborhood, incl. upgraded roads, sidewalks, streetscapes & parks.

Work side by side with Chief Architect, licensed Architects, Civil Engineer, Civil Drafter-Detailer, Project Coordinator & construction mgmt. team. Offices directly adjacent to primary construction & civil roadwork and public park development sites.

EXPERIENCE & OTHER REQUIREMENTS

• U.S. experience in multifamily/mixed use construction architectural design, drafting, detailing & document mgmt; at least some (or significant) high rise / mid rise multifamily/mixed use experience are a big plus.

• Must be legal U.S. resident, and currently live in or reasonable commute to Jersey City NJ.

• Able to ‘hit the ground running’ on architectural design, construction drafting, detailing, document management, plans, elevations, details, sections, shop & coordination drawings, site plans, exterior/interior layouts, etc. with general knowledge of mid/high rise building codes.

• Civil engineering drawing/detailing experience or exposure are a plus but not required.

• Architectural or other relevant degrees or technical training should be all or significantly U.S. based.

• Good writing & communication skills; prefers team interaction rather than solo setting; hard working, upbeat, pleasant.

OPPORTUNITY & BENEFITS

• True long term career opportunity; 5-6 years of primary project with other concurrent and future projects already in development.

• Work with experienced, friendly, energetic team, in offices with construction mgmt, legal, finance, HR. Professional development via frequent industry ‘lunch & learns’, and office adjacent to primary construction & civil sites for site visits and work with construction managers.

• Work hard but hours are reasonable.

• Very competitive salary based on education, certifications, experience and skills, past salary history.
Health insurance, 401K, paid vacations & personal days.

, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Address: Trainee Project Manager at High-End Glass Wall Company
column4:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, feel free to reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Wing Partners is looking for an energetic person to join our training program to become a Project Manager. No project management experience is necessary to join as a trainee. You'll learn everything from experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, and you should have some architecture, engineering or construction training.

You will be consulting with designers on the customization capabilities of our wall systems and coordinating the build-out of our clients' designs. You will interact with architects, especially during the drafting of shop drawings and submitting finish samples for approval. You'll assist our Project Managers in the office and in the field on active jobsites with reviewing bid requests, drafting and submitting shop drawings, and following the entire project timeline from bidding to completion.

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Review construction documents, put together bid packages
* Develop shop drawings in AutoCAD (or Revit if you know it)
* Field verification measurements
* Attend construction coordination meetings
* Assist with scheduling of deliveries and supervision of installers

REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in AutoCAD, Excel and Word. 
* Experience with Revit is a plus, but not required.
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Must be able to communicate with clients as well as general contractors and field labor.
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.
* Located in the NYC metro area

COMPENSATION AND TIME
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Typical hours are 9am-6pm, with occasional meetings starting at 8am. Training program lasts 90-180 days depending on performance. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. With excellent performance you'll graduate from Trainee to full Project Manager, which includes a pay raise.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, NBA, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. We're based in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Michael with your resume/cv, cover letter and 'your name - Wing Partners' in the subject. Thanks!

Address: Assistant Project Manager - Construction and Development
column4:
Job Description:

Level One Holdings is a vertically integrated company specializing in the acquisition, design and development of unique real estate assets. As the Owner, Developer and General Contractor, we shepherd every project from architectural and zoning feasibility studies, to design development, through construction, to completion.

This role is ideal for someone with experience in residential group up construction and construction management. Our ideal candidate is a positive, outgoing individual who is a team player, self-driven and extremely detail oriented. The candidate should be prepared to work in a small team that is very hands on.

Responsibilities

- Review of plans and specifications to understand the scope of the project
- Perform take-offs and level construction bids
- Draft detailed scopes of work to be used in the negotiations with subcontractors or suppliers
- Participate in project value engineering and purchasing
- Coordinate the timely submission and review of project submittals, RFIs and shop drawings
- Manage project information and documents on the company share file system 
- Work with the project expediter to manage filings, amendments and permitting
- Review subcontractor and vendor invoices, change orders and requisition
- Work with the Senior Project Manager and Field Superintendent to update the project Schedule on a weekly basis

Experience and qualifications:

- MUST have a minimum of 3 years experience in New York City residential ground up construction management 
- Experience either working as an assistant project manager or project architect
- Must be able to read plans, construction drawings and shop drawings
- Knowledge in Autocad and/or Bluebeam
- Understanding of the NYC Dept of Buildings permitting and project closeout process
- Strong organization and time management skills
- Strong written and oral communication skills

Thanks, we're looking forward to hearing from you!

Address: Career Opportunities in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
column4:
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers at CAMBA assists highly skilled immigrant professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering. Courses are scheduled around the needs of working professionals and offered evenings and weekends. 
Since its inception in 1987, the Retraining Program helped connect more than 5,000 immigrant professionals to science, technology and engineering jobs. 

ALL SERVICES ARE FREE
Classes include:

OSHA 30
Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety
Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulation
Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition and Safety Regulation (HVAC)
National Electrical Code (NEC) and Its Applications
AISC Structural Steel Design
ACI Structural Concrete Design
Introduction to AutoCAD for Engineers
Advanced AutoCAD and Revit
Building Cost Estimating and Bridge, Highway, Railroad Engineering

To be considered for the program applicants must:

•Be born outside of the United States
•Be authorized to work in the United States
•Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin (not in US)
•Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years. (Exceptions for those in the U.S. more than five years may be made on a case-by-case basis)
•Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education
•Have intermediate+ English fluency
•Demonstrate a financial need
•Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search

Please, visit our web site: www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining   - for application instructions and for more information call 718-226-0437.

Address: Facade / Building Envelope Architect or Engineer
column4:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to exterior restoration of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking Architects and Engineers to help execute a growing slate of challenging projects. We’re currently considering candidates for a range of roles, from entry-level to 10 or more years of building-envelope experience.  
We offer the resources of a large firm with the collaborative culture of a smaller studio, plus access to industry-leading technology and an in-house non-destructive testing lab.
If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio.

We are a rapidly expanding, nationally known, architecture / interior design firm specializing in high-end projects, both residential and commercial, with a unique emphasis on luxury, high-budgeted, one-family homes. The bulk of our architectural projects are located in New York City, Brooklyn, Long Island and Southern Jersey. We maintain offices in Lower Manhattan and in Brooklyn. 

We are currently seeking a highly qualified, experienced architect to join our firm. Applicants must be proficient in the production of comprehensive, detailed construction-documents and shop-drawings for mid-sized commercial and residential projects, including one-family, luxury homes, and must have extensive knowledge of building systems, means and methods for various types of construction projects. 

Expertise in all of N.Y.C. zoning and code regulations and ADA compliance and experience in N.Y.C. DOB drawings and filings is a must.  Knowledge of international zoning and code regulations is a plus.  

Applicant must have excellent communication skills, capable of competently corresponding and interacting with professional consultants and with clients, must be a team player able to operate within a high-pressured, creative environment, and must be capable of concentrating on a variety of projects simultaneously and completing projects within a strict time-frame. 

Since all of our projects require extremely high standards of design, we are looking for a talented professional who is  passionate about cutting-edge and innovative design, who has excellent architectural-design sensibilities, and who has expertise in various design styles with an updated knowledge of cutting-edge construction-related materials and methods. 

	Applicant's requirements:

•	 Bachelor or Master degree in Architecture 
•	 A minimum of 5 years of relevant architectural experience

Here at Energy Spray Systems, we are looking for an individual who has a basic familiarity with thermal envelope systems and is responsible for appropriately evaluating insulation and waterproofing materials used for given projects as provided by plans, specifications, and/or communication with our clients, builders, and architects. You will become familiar with our competitive advantages as an organization and will be able to communicate those to our benefit throughout the bidding process of both residential and commercial project. 

Responsibilities
•	Preparing detailed and accurate insulation project takeoffs and estimates.
•	Reading and understanding plan drawings and specifications and interfacing with general contractors and architects.
•	Proposing and negotiating innovative and cost-saving solutions to our clients.
•	Understanding project goals, deadlines and revising estimates as necessary throughout the bidding process.
•	Maintaining knowledge of prior experience and new competitive advantages in the industry to aid in the bidding process.
•	Obtaining up to date and accurate prices for thermal system materials. 


Requirements and Qualifications
•	Must be able to work on-site at our office in Stamford. 
•	1 – 3 years of construction or architecture experience; insulation/waterproofing systems experience preferred.
•	Basic knowledge of insulation and waterproofing products. 
•	Proficiency in Microsoft Office software.
•	Knowledge and experience using construction estimating software preferred; for example, Bluebeam Revu. 
•	Strong blueprint/plan-reading skills.
•	Solid understanding of basic mathematical principles
•	Stable work history.
•	Highly organized and detail oriented. 
•	Strong problem-solving skills.
•	Excellent time management skills, with adherence to milestones and deadlines.
•	Ability to handle large amounts of data entry and analysis.

Select NYC Millwork is a high-end millwork and furniture producer in New York City. We are looking for a qualified analytical millwork estimator to join the team. , New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

We are currently seeking a Junior Project Architect with a minimum of 2 years experience to join our team.

As a member of our team, you will work with senior staff and the Principal to execute residential projects. You will gain experience in generating designs, presentations and drawings, researching codes, managing schedules, and coordinating with clients, contractors, expeditors, city agencies, vendors, consultants, etc. throughout the entire process of the project from initial client meetings to punch-list closeout. The nature of our business requires immense organization, efficiency, and commitment, but we also maintain a very stable work/life balance.

For 29 years, Joseph Vance Architects has been designing high end, custom residential projects - brownstone/townhouse gut renovations, lofts, rooftop additions and conversions of manufacturing buildings to residential. We are a small group of creative problem solvers with a taste for well-crafted design. We value hard work to continuously grow and evolve, pushing boundaries until a project is the best it can be.

Current projects include a ground up new 6 story townhouse in the Upper West Side (with a new basketball court beneath), a gut renovation of a townhouse in Chelsea including a totally new facade, a 6,000sf triplex in a new West Village development, and others.

Ideally you have experience in residential architecture in NYC, some knowledge of NYC DOB and LPC, have worked with 3D modeling/BIM software and the adobe creative suite. We also expect you to have a great design sensibility and critical thinking skills.

If this sounds like you, then please submit a pdf of your cover letter, resume, and work sample. This is a full time salaried position with medical coverage (no part-time or freelance work). We look forward to hearing from you and appreciate your interest in our firm!

Surveyor layout

Fast Growing Contractor in NY metropolitan area looking for a survey/layout man.
Work includes excavation, foundations, SOE, and concrete superstructures.

Responsibilities are as follows ( But Are Not Limited To)

•	Proficient in current surveying techniques using different types of total stations, data collectors, GPS Equipment and Robotic Instruments.
•	Ability to use surveying and CAD software.
•	Performs boundary, topographic, utilities surveying and construction stake out.
•	Holds level or stadia rod at designated points to assist in determining elevations and laying out stakes.
•	Calls out reading or writes station number and reading in notebook.
•	Marks points of measurement with elevation, station number, or other identifying mark.
•	Measures distance between survey points with steel tape, cloth tape or electronic instruments.
•	Marks measuring points with keel (marking crayon), paint sticks, scratches, tacks, or stakes.
•	Places stakes at designated points and drives them into ground at specified elevation.
•	Performs other duties as required.
•	Operates survey instruments virtually every day with little or no supervision, while striving to increase speed and accuracy.
•	Makes field book notes and sketches of data gathered at job site.
•	Prepares as-built drawings as required. 


Requirements

•	Bachelor's degree preferred but not required.
•	Minimum of 5 year of related experience.
•	Ability to use surveying and CAD software.
•	Experience with boundary, topographic, utilities surveying and construction stake out.
•	Carry layout up through superstructure floors.
•	Must have a valid New York or New Jersey Driver's License.
Excellent salary for right candidate with bonus opportunities. 
We are an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer.

We have an immediate opening for a floor plan measurer. This is a flexible position for part-time work (contractor). You will set your own schedule and we will fit appointments into your availability (M-F, 9-5 only). 

Applicant must be highly experienced in creating as-built condition drawings (floor plans) of residential and commercial properties in CAD. Applicant must have the ability to create CAD drawings on-site using own laptop and AutoCAD software. Taking measurements on paper and later transferring to CAD drawings is NOT acceptable. Applicant must use a laser tape measure on-site.

Applicant must:
- Have a good understanding of building construction
- Be highly-proficient in CAD
- Have availability during normal weekday business hours: 9-5 to survey properties (please do not apply if you are looking for after-hour or weekend appointments.)
- Have own vehicle to visit properties
- Be reliable and very detail oriented

There are no set number of measurements in a day or week as appointments vary from week to week. We prefer a candidate with lots of availability but can set up as many or as few appointments as desired. This is a great, flexible opportunity for the right candidate.

Compensation: $50 per hr plus $10 travel and $10 per diem

Please send email with your previous work experience and education. 
You must use the following subject line in your email: "Re: Floor Plan Measurer - New York"

This will help to eliminate the use of fossil fuels for heating in the city and would improve air quality.

To provide Management, Supervision and coordination for all phases of NYC School Construction Authority projects, including coordinating subcontractors, material and equipment, ensuring that specifications are being strictly followed, and work is proceeding on schedule and within budget. PM/Superintendent shall be responsible for scheduling, inspections, quality control, and job site safety. 

Essential Functions / Major Responsibilities of PM/Superintendent: 
 
Schedule subcontractors, consultants, and vendors in critical path to ensure timely completion.  
Perform quality control duties and responsibilities regarding the work being performed.  
Communicate with project team regarding Change Orders, RFI’s, and Material Submittals. 
Ensure that subcontractors are fully executing and complying with his contracted scope of work.  
Coordinate required inspections with local owner QA-QC and Controlled lab.  
Identify subcontractor non-compliance with safety, health, and environmental quality standards.  
Identify conflicts in construction progress and communicate them to project team for resolution.  
Maintain daily log (written) of activities on the jobsite.  
 Ensure subcontractor has corrected all deficiencies identified by project team.  
Preside over weekly subcontractor meetings designed to coordinate the work.  
Issue notices of non-compliance to subcontractors in regards to quality of work or scheduling or safety.  
Ensure that the job site is always kept in a clean and organized manner.  
Perform job progress and completion punch list identification and completion. 
 
Secondary Functions:  
 
Assist in budgeting, bidding, and award of subcontracts.  
Assist in obtaining permits or approval of revisions.  
Gather project material submittals and maintain records of approvals at the job-site.  
Preside at pre-construction meeting with each subcontractor.  
Assist in hiring sub-tier employees.

Address: Class 2 Senior Project Manager / Code Consultant
column4:
A Manhattan based full-service expediting, building compliance and consulting firm, is seeking a full-time, experienced Senior Project Manager / Code Consultant who possesses a Class 2 DOB License.

Required Credentials for Position:
•	Active NYC DOB Code and Zoning Representative Class 2 License & FDNY File Rep ID
•	Minimum five to ten (5-10) years of relevant experience and working with agencies such as DOB, FDNY, 
        ECB, DEP...etc.
•	Ability to attend appointments with Department of Buildings Plan Examiners to review and answer 
        objections and report back to the superiors
•	Ability to attend Environmental Control Board Hearings and aid in dismissing open violations (A PLUS)
•	Responsible for following up on all submissions and report Department of Buildings findings to the office
•	Review architectural and engineering plans for compliance to applicable building codes and zoning 
        regulations.
•	Distribute the forms to the architect, engineer, building owner, contractor, etc., in order to obtain the 
        required signatures and seals.
•	Coordinate the submission of the architectural and or engineering plans to DOB.
•	Correspondence and communication with the architect, engineer, building owner, contractor, etc. to resolve 
        DOB objections and obtain approval and work permits.
•	Serve as a liaison between the field personnel and the architect, engineer, building owner, contractor, etc. to 
        resolve DOB objections and obtain approval and work permits and sign-offs.
•	Experience with the preparation of DOB forms, permits and violation documentation
•	Experience with Development Hub
•	Experience with DOB NOW
•	Able to use Microsoft Office Suite (OUTLOOK, WORD, EXCEL)
•	Responsible for following up on all projects
•	Professional attitude with great communication (written and verbal) and organizational skills a must
•	Ability to the follow office protocols and procedures a must
•	Team Player with strong Project Management skills

Education Requirements:
•	College Degree in Related Field (preferred)

Compensation: Competitive Compensation- commensurate with experience and includes health, dental and vision options available. Paid vacation, personal, and sick days as well.

New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 2-5 years’ relevant experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.  
 
We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like facade inspections and repairs (Local Law 11), roof repairs, and investigation and remediation of structural issues. We've won numerous awards—including ten Lucy Moses preservation awards—as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.  

Absolutely. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer applications that integrate construction drawings, specifications, cost estimating, scheduling, and construction administration; advanced photography and image processing; and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. In fact, we have an in-house studio dedicated to such supporting technology, constantly developing new digital tools (think James Bond’s “Q”).    .

 
Honestly, we offer aspects of both. You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This gives you the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm.  

You’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

An array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks.  
 
We embrace all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls.  


We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:





Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.



Send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or a link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. We look forward to meeting you! 

Please note that, due to the high number of applicants, we can only contact candidates under consideration.

Address: Use LEGO® to teach kids engineering concepts!
column4:
Are you a tinkerer? Do you enjoy taking things apart and then putting them back together? How about playing with LEGO®? Would you like to use a ridiculous amount of LEGO® materials to teach kids how the world works? If so, then this may be your dream job!


 is an educational enrichment company that introduces children in grades K-8 to STEM concepts using LEGO® components.


We are hiring additional smart, creative, dynamic LEGO® Engineering Instructors to join our team delivering our great programs throughout the NYC Metro area with highest current needs in Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens, Long Island/Nassau County, and Westchester. This part-time position includes teaching daily after-school programs during the school year with some weekend birthday parties or community events, and full day camp programs during the summer.  


Buckle up - this is hard work! Lugging 40 pound totes in and out of your car, leading excited kids through challenging projects, managing classroom conflicts, cleaning up all that LEGO® - 






 We also pay a 3 hour daily class minimum rather than just the hour or so spent in the classroom.

Job Description:

We are currently seeking structural engineers at multiple levels to join our team. As a structural engineer, you will work with other team members in our highly collaborative environment to assure that designs are developed in accordance with appropriate codes and standards, quality control objectives are achieved, and project goals are met within the schedule and budget. This is an outstanding opportunity for a structural engineer to work on a variety of high-profile projects throughout the region. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

- Coordinate with architects, contractors, owners, and other engineers from the initial planning stages through final construction.
- Determine design criteria using relevant codes and standards.
- Analyze and/or prepare models and calculations for various structural elements and systems by using various software and/or hand calculations.
- Develop contract documents, including construction drawings and technical specifications
- Produce schematic and detailed designs and evaluation of planning and concept alternatives
- Review shop drawings, RFI's.
- Perform field inspections and write inspection reports.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Familiar with latest version of AutoCAD, Revit, ETABS, SAP2000, SAFE, RAM, Excel.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Ability to effectively work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
- Must be eligible to work in the United States

Entry Level Candidates:
- Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.

Intermediate Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 3+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.

Advance Level Candidates:
- Master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
- 8+ years of related work experience in concrete or steel framing building structural design, support-of-excavation and foundation system design, steel or concrete rebar shop drawing design, construction support design and field inspection.
- NYS PE License

Salary up to 100K

3 to 5+ years of architectural design, drafting, detailing & managing construction-related plans, drawings, documents for multifamily/mixed use projects, using AutoCAD, Revit and other tools.

URBAN ARCHITECTURE LLC is a small ‘design/build’ architectural & civil engineering firm in Jersey City, working in-house with MANHATTAN BUILDING COMPANY, private developer/ builder of award winning projects in Hudson County, NJ.
Continuing long term development, design, construction of mid/high rise luxury multifamily/ mixed use projects in historic neighborhood, incl. upgraded roads, sidewalks, streetscapes & parks.

EXPERIENCE & OTHER REQUIREMENTS

• Civil engineering drawing/detailing experience or exposure are a plus but not required.

• Architectural or other relevant degrees or technical training should be all or significantly U.S. based.

• Good writing & communication skills; prefers team interaction rather than solo setting; hard working, upbeat, pleasant.

OPPORTUNITY & BENEFITS

• True long term career opportunity; 5-6 years of primary project with other concurrent and future projects already in development.

• Work with experienced, friendly, energetic team, in offices with construction mgmt, legal, finance, HR. Professional development via frequent industry ‘lunch & learns’, and office adjacent to primary construction & civil sites for site visits and work with construction managers.

• Work hard but hours are reasonable.

- In-depth understanding of how cabinets and millwork are built and installed
- Ability to take detailed site measurements

The ideal candidate will be proficient in:
- AutoCAD LT
- Rhino
- Excel

We are open to part time work with the right candidate. The hourly rate will be commensurate with experience. We strive for a reasonable work/life balance with regular hours of 10-6. There may be some occasional late days

, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like facade inspections and repairs (Local Law 11), roof repairs, and investigation and remediation of structural issues. We've won numerous awards—including ten Lucy Moses preservation awards—as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.  

Absolutely. Job Description:

Level One Holdings is a vertically integrated company specializing in the acquisition, design and development of unique real estate assets. As the Owner, Developer and General Contractor, we shepherd every project from architectural and zoning feasibility studies, to design development, through construction, to completion.

This role is ideal for someone with experience in residential group up construction and construction management. Our ideal candidate is a positive, outgoing individual who is a team player, self-driven and extremely detail oriented. The candidate should be prepared to work in a small team that is very hands on.

Responsibilities

- Review of plans and specifications to understand the scope of the project
- Perform take-offs and level construction bids
- Draft detailed scopes of work to be used in the negotiations with subcontractors or suppliers
- Participate in project value engineering and purchasing
- Coordinate the timely submission and review of project submittals, RFIs and shop drawings
- Manage project information and documents on the company share file system 
- Work with the project expediter to manage filings, amendments and permitting
- Review subcontractor and vendor invoices, change orders and requisition
- Work with the Senior Project Manager and Field Superintendent to update the project Schedule on a weekly basis

Experience and qualifications:

- MUST have a minimum of 3 years experience in New York City residential ground up construction management 
- Experience either working as an assistant project manager or project architect
- Must be able to read plans, construction drawings and shop drawings
- Knowledge in Autocad and/or Bluebeam
- Understanding of the NYC Dept of Buildings permitting and project closeout process
- Strong organization and time management skills
- Strong written and oral communication skills

Benefits:

- Health Insurance
- Incentive bonuses
- Vacation Pay

JUNIOR ENGINEER / ARCHITECT

Founded in 1987, RAND Engineering & Architecture, DPC is a 100-person Manhattan-based firm that designs, specifies, and administers restoration, upgrade, and adaptive re-use programs on behalf of owners, managers, and co-op and condo boards.

We are currently seeking an engineering or architectural graduate to prepare specifications and reports on exterior facade and roofing repair/restoration projects. 

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
•	Manage projects, with project manager, from start to finish including design scope, City approval process, bidding, construction documents and construction administration
•	Act as point person for clients, contractors, consultants, vendors and in-house tea
•	Prepare project progress reports
•	Complete design drawings in AutoCAD
•	Work with senior staff to create and deliver client presentations
•	Work with contractor to resolve issues encountered in the construction process

Qualifications
•	B. or M. in Architecture or Engineering
•	Construction Administration field experience as plus.
•	Ability to work well under pressure, juggle and prioritize multiple projects and adjust work accordingly, often against tight deadlines. Strong organizational skills
•	Ability to interact with team members including, external client organizations and vendors.
•	Pursuing professional certifications or licensure a plus.
•	Positive attitude with proven proficiency working collaboratively within a team setting.
•	Strong work ethic, ability to work efficiently and with accuracy, takes responsibility for own work.
•	Self-motivated individuals capable of assuming increasing responsibility for both current and future projects, and who are interested in growing with the firm.

Unsolicited resumes from third party agencies will not be accepted.   

RAND Offers a comprehensive benefits package that features health and dental coverage, a company sponsored vision plan, 401(k) retirement plan with company match, long-term disability, life-insurance, educational opportunities, transit and parking exemptions, employee gym on site, yoga, kickboxing, personal trainer, employee referral program, career development, casual Fridays, and holiday parties. In 9 different years, (including 2019), RAND has been voted one of  Crain’s Top 100 Places to Work in NYC.

Applicants should send cover letter, resume, writing samples, and salary requirements to hr@randpc.com. Please reference ad F&R2020.

Address: Trainee Project Manager at High-End Glass Wall Company
column4:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, feel free to reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Wing Partners is looking for an energetic person to join our training program to become a Project Manager. No project management experience is necessary to join as a trainee. You'll learn everything from experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, and you should have some architecture, engineering or construction training.

You will be consulting with designers on the customization capabilities of our wall systems and coordinating the build-out of our clients' designs. You will interact with architects, especially during the drafting of shop drawings and submitting finish samples for approval. You'll assist our Project Managers in the office and in the field on active jobsites with reviewing bid requests, drafting and submitting shop drawings, and following the entire project timeline from bidding to completion.

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Review construction documents, put together bid packages
* Develop shop drawings in AutoCAD (or Revit if you know it)
* Field verification measurements
* Attend construction coordination meetings
* Assist with scheduling of deliveries and supervision of installers

REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in AutoCAD, Excel and Word. 
* Experience with Revit is a plus, but not required.
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Must be able to communicate with clients as well as general contractors and field labor.
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.
* Located in the NYC metro area

COMPENSATION AND TIME
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Typical hours are 9am-6pm, with occasional meetings starting at 8am. Training program lasts 90-180 days depending on performance. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. With excellent performance you'll graduate from Trainee to full Project Manager, which includes a pay raise.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, NBA, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. We're based in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Michael with your resume/cv, cover letter and 'your name - Wing Partners' in the subject. Thanks!

We are looking for an experienced architect who can handle a busy, fast-paced but exciting work environment.

• 5+ years of experience in project management. Must be ready to oversee and manage six or more simultaneous projects of varying sizes

Thanks, we're looking forward to hearing from you!

Address: Career Opportunities in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
column4:
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers at CAMBA assists highly skilled immigrant professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering. Courses are scheduled around the needs of working professionals and offered evenings and weekends. 
Since its inception in 1987, the Retraining Program helped connect more than 5,000 immigrant professionals to science, technology and engineering jobs. 

ALL SERVICES ARE FREE
Classes include:

OSHA 30
Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety
Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulation
Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition and Safety Regulation (HVAC)
National Electrical Code (NEC) and Its Applications
AISC Structural Steel Design
ACI Structural Concrete Design
Introduction to AutoCAD for Engineers
Advanced AutoCAD and Revit
Building Cost Estimating and Bridge, Highway, Railroad Engineering

To be considered for the program applicants must:

•Be born outside of the United States
•Be authorized to work in the United States
•Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin (not in US)
•Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years. (Exceptions for those in the U.S. more than five years may be made on a case-by-case basis)
•Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education
•Have intermediate+ English fluency
•Demonstrate a financial need
•Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search

Please, visit our web site: www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining   - for application instructions and for more information call 718-226-0437.

Address: Construction Project Manager / Project Manager / Const. Superintendent
column4:
Construction Project Manager/ Construction Project Manager / Construction Superintendent

Fast growing, dynamic concrete construction company seeks a number of project managers for work in the New York City area.

Candidates should possess a thorough knowledge of the construction process and be computer literate. Duties will include supervising a large staff and scheduling work in an efficient manner to ensure compliance with clients’ requirements.  Understanding blueprints and shop drawing together with submittals is a prerequisite. Work includes excavation, shoring, and concrete from foundation all the way up to roof.  Duties will include all the functions normally associated with project management on jobs from five to fifty floors high.  Knowledge of New York City and FDNY codes and requirements is required. 

Successful candidates will be joining a successful team and will receive support to help him/her succeed in a very fast moving environment. 

Very competitive salary together with generous bonus on completion of projects.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

Construction Estimator/Project Manager

Established NYC based Construction firm seeks self-motivated energetic individual with minimum 10 years' experience to join our team.  

Duties Include: Preparing detailed take-offs and estimates, analyzing architectural drawings, developing scope of work, preparing formal proposals, attend meetings and walk throughs, solicit bids from subcontractors and vendors, manage projects, cost control, submittals and scheduling. 

Candidate must have thorough knowledge of computer programs especially Excel, Word, Planswift and MS Project and possess strong analytical and communication skills with an eye for detail.

BA/BS in architecture or engineering preferred.  Drawing, sketching and Auto CAD proficiency a plus.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

We are a rapidly expanding, nationally known, architecture / interior design firm specializing in high-end projects, both residential and commercial, with a unique emphasis on luxury, high-budgeted, one-family homes. The bulk of our architectural projects are located in New York City, Brooklyn, Long Island and Southern Jersey. We maintain offices in Lower Manhattan and in Brooklyn. 

We are currently seeking a highly qualified, experienced architect to join our firm. Applicants must be proficient in the production of comprehensive, detailed construction-documents and shop-drawings for mid-sized commercial and residential projects, including one-family, luxury homes, and must have extensive knowledge of building systems, means and methods for various types of construction projects. 

Expertise in all of N.Y.C. zoning and code regulations and ADA compliance and experience in N.Y.C. DOB drawings and filings is a must.  Knowledge of international zoning and code regulations is a plus.  

Applicant must have excellent communication skills, capable of competently corresponding and interacting with professional consultants and with clients, must be a team player able to operate within a high-pressured, creative environment, and must be capable of concentrating on a variety of projects simultaneously and completing projects within a strict time-frame. 

Since all of our projects require extremely high standards of design, we are looking for a talented professional who is  passionate about cutting-edge and innovative design, who has excellent architectural-design sensibilities, and who has expertise in various design styles with an updated knowledge of cutting-edge construction-related materials and methods. 

	Applicant's requirements:

•	 Bachelor or Master degree in Architecture 
•	 A minimum of 5 years of relevant architectural experience
•	 Extreme proficiency with AutoCAD drawing   
•	 Experience in both mid-sized building projects and construction of exclusive, luxury homes 
•	 Ability to produce intricate, detail-oriented sets of construction documents and shop drawings
•	 Experience with site planning, zoning analysis, and code compliance.
•	 Expertise in NYC zoning and code regulations and ADA compliance requirements 
•	 Experience with NYC DOB filing procedures and regulations 
•	 Strong creative/design talents and excellent graphic-presentation skills  
•	 Strong oral and written communication skills   
•	 Ability to work within a team and to supervise junior staff
•	 Proficiency with 3D Modeling and graphic platforms and software is a plus

We are offering benefits after a three month trial period, with industry standard paid vacation, holidays and personal days off. 

Compensation is commensurate with candidate's qualifications, skills and experience

To apply, please email your CV together with samples of your work to the email address provided.

Amuneal is looking to add an experienced kitchen designer to our team. This role will collaborate with our in-house Sales and Design team to work with our clients in developing highly customized kitchens, bars and various installations for their projects. 

Supported by our current and ever-growing designs and our NYC Showroom, this role is envisioned to be both pragmatic and creative, delivering layouts based on years of functional experience within an overall design that feels bespoke to each project.

Candidates must have experience in high-end kitchen design and must be proficient in conveying design ideas through hand-sketching and software. In addition to creating design options and layouts, the role will be integral to developing and revising pricing, documenting our scope of work through written proposals and working through the details of each project with our engineers, project managers and fabrication team.

The role can be based in either NYC or Philadelphia, but will include travel between the two locations, as required, to support our customers and our internal teams.

Required Skills + Traits
Clean Design Aesthetic: Ability to translate conversations into designs aligned with Amuneal’s aesthetic and product quality.
Strong Social Skills and Professionalism: Be articulate, creative, energetic, disciplined, and flexible while communicating with clients directly and representing the Amuneal brand.
Problem Solve: Solutions to problems aren’t always apparent: must be able to think creatively and develop solutions to challenges relating to design/fabrication as well as sales initiatives. Draw actionable insights from meetings and conversations.
Passionate Learning: Must be eager to learn about Amuneal’s history, projects, and processes.
Comprehension of Basic Construction Principles: Blocking, wiring, field tolerances, logistics, etc.
Diligence: Dedication to stay on top of projects and push them forward to meet deadlines.
Self-motivation/Initiative: Take ownership of projects.
Time Management: Manage your own time and work under pressure on several simultaneous project with a clear timeline of completion.

Please submit cover letter, resume and at least 5 examples of relevant work including 1 hand drawn sample.

Please be sure to include your full name and the position you are applying for in your email subject.
