Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Manager
column4:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Absolutely. You’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

An array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks.  
 
We embrace all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls.  


We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:





Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.

Title: Trainee Project Manager at High-End Glass Wall Company
column4:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, feel free to reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Wing Partners is looking for an energetic person to join our training program to become a Project Manager. No project management experience is necessary to join as a trainee. You'll learn everything from experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, and you should have some architecture, engineering or construction training.

You will be consulting with designers on the customization capabilities of our wall systems and coordinating the build-out of our clients' designs. You will interact with architects, especially during the drafting of shop drawings and submitting finish samples for approval. You'll assist our Project Managers in the office and in the field on active jobsites with reviewing bid requests, drafting and submitting shop drawings, and following the entire project timeline from bidding to completion.

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Review construction documents, put together bid packages
* Develop shop drawings in AutoCAD (or Revit if you know it)
* Field verification measurements
* Attend construction coordination meetings
* Assist with scheduling of deliveries and supervision of installers

REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in AutoCAD, Excel and Word. 
* Experience with Revit is a plus, but not required.
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Must be able to communicate with clients as well as general contractors and field labor.
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.
* Located in the NYC metro area

COMPENSATION AND TIME
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Typical hours are 9am-6pm, with occasional meetings starting at 8am. Training program lasts 90-180 days depending on performance. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. With excellent performance you'll graduate from Trainee to full Project Manager, which includes a pay raise.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, NBA, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. We're based in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Michael with your resume/cv, cover letter and 'your name - Wing Partners' in the subject. Thanks!

Title: Project Coordinator/Manager
column4:
Brooklyn based Expediting company seeking an experienced full-time NYC Project Coordinator/Manager, Our office offers a fun and energetic environment with room for professional growth.

We are explicitly looking for someone that already has experience with the NYC Department of Buildings and possesses a valid Class 2 Filing Representative License.

Responsibilities will include the following:
- Coordinating, communicating and meeting with clients, professional consultants, and DOB personnel.
- Preparation & filing of all application types including DOB Now.
- Acquiring work permits.
- Code and zoning research.
- Attending plan exams.
- Violation removal with DOB/ECB and FDNY.
- Attending inspections.

Candidates Qualifications:

- Ability to communicate with clients and professional consultants
- Knowledge of NYC filing, permitting and sign-off procedures
- Ability to read architectural and engineering drawings
- Excellent communication skills
- Strong organization skills
- Self-motivated
- Be fluent in English
- Punctuality is a must
- Be able to work with a team
- A fun, energetic approach to work and business interactions.

Qualified individuals should:

Submit PDF resumes (not to exceed 5 MB)
Provide salary requirements in the body of your cover letter.

We are ready to hire you today if you qualify and have the experience we are looking for.

**** If you do not possess a Class 2 Filing Rep Status, have knowledge of required DOB/DEP/Landmarks and FDNY forms, and you cannot read a set of drawings, please do not apply for this job. We will ask you questions pertaining to forms and applications.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Thank you.

Title: Architect -Full Time-Immediate Hire
column4:
At GLA we are always looking for talented, educated, experienced, and passionate people to join our team. If you have a desire to be involved in a diverse Architecture Firm then GLA is a perfect work environment for you.

We are currently looking for an individual with 1 or 2 years of Professional Practice in an Architects Office.

GLA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Assistant Project Manager - Construction and Development
column4:
Job Description:

Level One Holdings is a vertically integrated company specializing in the acquisition, design and development of unique real estate assets. As the Owner, Developer and General Contractor, we shepherd every project from architectural and zoning feasibility studies, to design development, through construction, to completion.

This role is ideal for someone with experience in residential group up construction and construction management. Our ideal candidate is a positive, outgoing individual who is a team player, self-driven and extremely detail oriented. The candidate should be prepared to work in a small team that is very hands on.

Responsibilities

- Review of plans and specifications to understand the scope of the project
- Perform take-offs and level construction bids
- Draft detailed scopes of work to be used in the negotiations with subcontractors or suppliers
- Participate in project value engineering and purchasing
- Coordinate the timely submission and review of project submittals, RFIs and shop drawings
- Manage project information and documents on the company share file system 
- Work with the project expediter to manage filings, amendments and permitting
- Review subcontractor and vendor invoices, change orders and requisition
- Work with the Senior Project Manager and Field Superintendent to update the project Schedule on a weekly basis

Experience and qualifications:

- MUST have a minimum of 3 years experience in New York City residential ground up construction management 
- Experience either working as an assistant project manager or project architect
- Must be able to read plans, construction drawings and shop drawings
- Knowledge in Autocad and/or Bluebeam
- Understanding of the NYC Dept of Buildings permitting and project closeout process
- Strong organization and time management skills
- Strong written and oral communication skills

Benefits:

- Health Insurance
- Incentive bonuses
- Vacation Pay

Title: Senior Architect
column4:
Senior Architect
Nelligan White Architects is a 25‐person firm located in New York’s Flatiron district. The majority of our design work is focused on municipal, cultural, education and multi‐residential housing projects, and we have been recognized for our expertise in resilience master planning and sustainability.

Ideal applicants will demonstrate the following attributes:

•	Highly motivated
•	The ability to work independently and leading a team
•	Exemplary verbal and written communication
•	Senior level work experience with all phases of design and construction administration
•	Be a conceptual thinker with strong technical skills (design and drawing)
•	Experience providing detailed construction documents 
•	Experience writing specifications
•	The ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment

Responsibilities & Duties
•	Prepare original architectural plans, diagrams and data visualization.
•	Lead design assignments and supervise team progress.
•	Independently evaluate, select and apply standard planning techniques, procedures, and criteria
•	Using judgment for minor adaptations and modifications.
•	Recommend procedures in planning matters.
•	Work from plans/designs of others to compile data and perform design computations.
•	Assist in writing specifications.
•	Visits construction sites to gather information.
•	Receives instruction on specific assignment objectives and independently provides solutions for these objectives.
•	Support Principal/Partners on large projects.
•	Manage a team of intermediate to junior designers

Qualifications
•	10 years’ experience with a professional degree in Architecture and license preferred
•	High proficiency with AutoCAD. Adobe Suite and Revit knowledge is a plus.
•	Strong analytical and conceptual skills and ability to grasp complex functional program requirements.
•	Effective verbal and written communication skills.
•	The ability to work well leading a team environment with a collaborative and professional work ethic.
•	Experience working with large public agencies is a plus

Apply with the following items attached as one PDF in a zip file, Please enter “Intermediate Architect” in the subject line.
•	Cover letter
•	Resume in PDF format
•	Portfolio and work samples include renderings and construction document samples
•	Salary requirements
•	Two references that you have worked directly with in the last five years

Nelligan White Architects offers a competitive salary and benefits package, which includes: medical, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending account, disability insurance, paid time off, holiday pay and 401(k) participation. This is a full‐time, exempt position.

Nelligan White Architects, PLLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Nelligan White Architects expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status.

Title: Project Manager/Site Superintendent
column4:
To provide Management, Supervision and coordination for all phases of NYC School Construction Authority projects, including coordinating subcontractors, material and equipment, ensuring that specifications are being strictly followed, and work is proceeding on schedule and within budget. PM/Superintendent shall be responsible for scheduling, inspections, quality control, and job site safety. 

Essential Functions / Major Responsibilities of PM/Superintendent: 
 
Schedule subcontractors, consultants, and vendors in critical path to ensure timely completion.  
Perform quality control duties and responsibilities regarding the work being performed.  
Communicate with project team regarding Change Orders, RFI’s, and Material Submittals. 
Ensure that subcontractors are fully executing and complying with his contracted scope of work.  
Coordinate required inspections with local owner QA-QC and Controlled lab.  
Identify subcontractor non-compliance with safety, health, and environmental quality standards.  
Identify conflicts in construction progress and communicate them to project team for resolution.  
Maintain daily log (written) of activities on the jobsite.  
 Ensure subcontractor has corrected all deficiencies identified by project team.  
Preside over weekly subcontractor meetings designed to coordinate the work.  
Issue notices of non-compliance to subcontractors in regards to quality of work or scheduling or safety.  
Ensure that the job site is always kept in a clean and organized manner.  
Perform job progress and completion punch list identification and completion. 
 
Secondary Functions:  
 
Assist in budgeting, bidding, and award of subcontracts.  
Assist in obtaining permits or approval of revisions.  
Gather project material submittals and maintain records of approvals at the job-site.  
Preside at pre-construction meeting with each subcontractor.  
Assist in hiring sub-tier employees.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect
column4:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled architect with 2-5 years’ relevant experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.  
 
We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like facade inspections and repairs (Local Law 11), roof repairs, and investigation and remediation of structural issues. We've won numerous awards—including ten Lucy Moses preservation awards—as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.  

Absolutely. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer applications that integrate construction drawings, specifications, cost estimating, scheduling, and construction administration; advanced photography and image processing; and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. In fact, we have an in-house studio dedicated to such supporting technology, constantly developing new digital tools (think James Bond’s “Q”).    .

 
Honestly, we offer aspects of both. You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This gives you the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm.  

You’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

An array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks.  
 
We embrace all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls.  


We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:





Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away.



Send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or a link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. We look forward to meeting you! 

Please note that, due to the high number of applicants, we can only contact candidates under consideration.   

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Manager
column4:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Title: Use LEGO® to teach kids engineering concepts!
column4:
Are you a tinkerer? Do you enjoy taking things apart and then putting them back together? How about playing with LEGO®? Would you like to use a ridiculous amount of LEGO® materials to teach kids how the world works? If so, then this may be your dream job!


 is an educational enrichment company that introduces children in grades K-8 to STEM concepts using LEGO® components.


We are hiring additional smart, creative, dynamic LEGO® Engineering Instructors to join our team delivering our great programs throughout the NYC Metro area with highest current needs in Brooklyn, Bronx, Queens, Long Island/Nassau County, and Westchester. This part-time position includes teaching daily after-school programs during the school year with some weekend birthday parties or community events, and full day camp programs during the summer.  


Buckle up - this is hard work! Lugging 40 pound totes in and out of your car, leading excited kids through challenging projects, managing classroom conflicts, cleaning up all that LEGO® - 






 We also pay a 3 hour daily class minimum rather than just the hour or so spent in the classroom.   


	
		

	



Visit  to learn more about the job and submit your online application!
 
 

 
 
Find us on Facebook: 
 
 
**This organization is not affiliated with the LEGO® GROUP.**

Title: Architecture Project Manager
column4:
We’re looking for a full-time architecture project manager to join our small team of easygoing, talented and hardworking designers and architects. This is a creative role that requires someone with a passion for design and an innovative vision. The role will also rely heavily on performance in a fast-paced environment, both individually and managerially. If you're familiar with our work and excited to join our team and create with us, we'd love to hear from you. 

Here’s a bit more about who we’re looking for…
• Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Architecture
• 5+ years of experience in project management. Must be ready to oversee and manage six or more simultaneous projects of varying sizes
• 5+ years of experience in NYC producing full construction document sets in AutoCAD 
• This position communicates directly with firm principals and clients. Candidate must be presentable and possess excellent communication skills, grammar, and vocabulary (both written and verbal)
• Must be highly proficient in creating/modifying architectural documents, designs, working drawings, forms, charts and records in AutoCAD
• This position will be responsible for ensuring all construction-related deliverables are in alignment with our overall design intent and coordinated between all parties throughout the course of any given project. 
• Experience in leveling bids, and communicating directly with contractors, subcontractors, and consultants
• Must be able to acquire and assemble the information needed to finish architectural drawings, and make shop and site visits as needed
• Must be proficient in specification book creation and sourcing of new and innovative materials including plumbing, hardware, wall, ceiling and floor finishes, etc. 
• This position will require some travel to job sites outside of NYC. Must have a valid US driver's license, car ownership is a plus.
• Availability to start immediately and work full-time, Monday through Friday, 9 AM to 6 PM

If all of the above sounds like you, we’d love to meet you and discuss the possibility of working together. Please send an introduction and tell us why you’d make a great addition to our team. Please include your resume as well as examples of your work in PDF format. Salary will be commensurate with the level of experience.

Thanks, we're looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Construction Project Manager / Project Manager / Const. Superintendent
column4:
Construction Project Manager/ Construction Project Manager / Construction Superintendent

Fast growing, dynamic concrete construction company seeks a number of project managers for work in the New York City area.

Candidates should possess a thorough knowledge of the construction process and be computer literate. Duties will include supervising a large staff and scheduling work in an efficient manner to ensure compliance with clients’ requirements.  Understanding blueprints and shop drawing together with submittals is a prerequisite. Work includes excavation, shoring, and concrete from foundation all the way up to roof.  Duties will include all the functions normally associated with project management on jobs from five to fifty floors high.  Knowledge of New York City and FDNY codes and requirements is required. 

Successful candidates will be joining a successful team and will receive support to help him/her succeed in a very fast moving environment. 

Very competitive salary together with generous bonus on completion of projects.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Architect, Intermediate
column4:
We are a rapidly expanding, nationally known, architecture / interior design firm specializing in high-end projects, both residential and commercial, with a unique emphasis on luxury, high-budgeted, one-family homes. The bulk of our architectural projects are located in New York City, Brooklyn, Long Island and Southern Jersey. We maintain offices in Lower Manhattan and in Brooklyn. 

We are currently seeking a highly qualified, experienced architect to join our firm. Applicants must be proficient in the production of comprehensive, detailed construction-documents and shop-drawings for mid-sized commercial and residential projects, including one-family, luxury homes, and must have extensive knowledge of building systems, means and methods for various types of construction projects. 

Expertise in all of N.Y.C. zoning and code regulations and ADA compliance and experience in N.Y.C. DOB drawings and filings is a must.  Knowledge of international zoning and code regulations is a plus.  

Applicant must have excellent communication skills, capable of competently corresponding and interacting with professional consultants and with clients, must be a team player able to operate within a high-pressured, creative environment, and must be capable of concentrating on a variety of projects simultaneously and completing projects within a strict time-frame. 

Since all of our projects require extremely high standards of design, we are looking for a talented professional who is  passionate about cutting-edge and innovative design, who has excellent architectural-design sensibilities, and who has expertise in various design styles with an updated knowledge of cutting-edge construction-related materials and methods. 

	Applicant's requirements:

•	 Bachelor or Master degree in Architecture 
•	 A minimum of 5 years of relevant architectural experience
•	 Extreme proficiency with AutoCAD drawing   
•	 Experience in both mid-sized building projects and construction of exclusive, luxury homes 
•	 Ability to produce intricate, detail-oriented sets of construction documents and shop drawings
•	 Experience with site planning, zoning analysis, and code compliance.
•	 Expertise in NYC zoning and code regulations and ADA compliance requirements 
•	 Experience with NYC DOB filing procedures and regulations 
•	 Strong creative/design talents and excellent graphic-presentation skills  
•	 Strong oral and written communication skills   
•	 Ability to work within a team and to supervise junior staff
•	 Proficiency with 3D Modeling and graphic platforms and software is a plus

We are offering benefits after a three month trial period, with industry standard paid vacation, holidays and personal days off. 

Compensation is commensurate with candidate's qualifications, skills and experience

To apply, please email your CV together with samples of your work to the email address provided.

Title: Career Opportunities in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
column4:
The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers at CAMBA assists highly skilled immigrant professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering. Courses are scheduled around the needs of working professionals and offered evenings and weekends. 
Since its inception in 1987, the Retraining Program helped connect more than 5,000 immigrant professionals to science, technology and engineering jobs. 

ALL SERVICES ARE FREE
Classes include:

OSHA 30
Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety
Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulation
Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition and Safety Regulation (HVAC)
National Electrical Code (NEC) and Its Applications
AISC Structural Steel Design
ACI Structural Concrete Design
Introduction to AutoCAD for Engineers
Advanced AutoCAD and Revit
Building Cost Estimating and Bridge, Highway, Railroad Engineering

To be considered for the program applicants must:

•Be born outside of the United States
•Be authorized to work in the United States
•Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin (not in US)
•Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years. (Exceptions for those in the U.S. more than five years may be made on a case-by-case basis)
•Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education
•Have intermediate+ English fluency
•Demonstrate a financial need
•Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search

Please, visit our web site: www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining   - for application instructions and for more information call 718-226-0437.

Title: High End Kitchen Designer
column4:
Amuneal is looking to add an experienced kitchen designer to our team. This role will collaborate with our in-house Sales and Design team to work with our clients in developing highly customized kitchens, bars and various installations for their projects. 

Supported by our current and ever-growing designs and our NYC Showroom, this role is envisioned to be both pragmatic and creative, delivering layouts based on years of functional experience within an overall design that feels bespoke to each project.

Candidates must have experience in high-end kitchen design and must be proficient in conveying design ideas through hand-sketching and software. In addition to creating design options and layouts, the role will be integral to developing and revising pricing, documenting our scope of work through written proposals and working through the details of each project with our engineers, project managers and fabrication team.

The role can be based in either NYC or Philadelphia, but will include travel between the two locations, as required, to support our customers and our internal teams.

Required Skills + Traits
Clean Design Aesthetic: Ability to translate conversations into designs aligned with Amuneal’s aesthetic and product quality.
Strong Social Skills and Professionalism: Be articulate, creative, energetic, disciplined, and flexible while communicating with clients directly and representing the Amuneal brand.
Problem Solve: Solutions to problems aren’t always apparent: must be able to think creatively and develop solutions to challenges relating to design/fabrication as well as sales initiatives. Draw actionable insights from meetings and conversations.
Passionate Learning: Must be eager to learn about Amuneal’s history, projects, and processes.
Comprehension of Basic Construction Principles: Blocking, wiring, field tolerances, logistics, etc.
Diligence: Dedication to stay on top of projects and push them forward to meet deadlines.
Self-motivation/Initiative: Take ownership of projects.
Time Management: Manage your own time and work under pressure on several simultaneous project with a clear timeline of completion.

Please submit cover letter, resume and at least 5 examples of relevant work including 1 hand drawn sample.

Please be sure to include your full name and the position you are applying for in your email subject.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Manager
column4:
, New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking a resourceful, skilled structural engineer or architect with 5 to 6 years of building envelope restoration experience if licensed, and 7 to 10 years' experience if not licensed, to join us as a Project Manager  in executing a growing slate of challenging projects. 

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region. 

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques. 

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready. 

We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities: :


Our light-filled Tribeca office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and stunning views of Manhattan in three directions—not a bad place to spend the work day. We’re easily accessible via public transportation: the A, C, and E Canal Street station connects directly to our building’s lobby. The N, R, 1, and 6 lines are all just a few blocks away. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities. 

With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted. 

For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit

Title: Construction Plans Estimator
column4:
Here at Energy Spray Systems, we are looking for an individual who has a basic familiarity with thermal envelope systems and is responsible for appropriately evaluating insulation and waterproofing materials used for given projects as provided by plans, specifications, and/or communication with our clients, builders, and architects. You will become familiar with our competitive advantages as an organization and will be able to communicate those to our benefit throughout the bidding process of both residential and commercial project. 

Responsibilities
•	Preparing detailed and accurate insulation project takeoffs and estimates.
•	Reading and understanding plan drawings and specifications and interfacing with general contractors and architects.
•	Proposing and negotiating innovative and cost-saving solutions to our clients.
•	Understanding project goals, deadlines and revising estimates as necessary throughout the bidding process.
•	Maintaining knowledge of prior experience and new competitive advantages in the industry to aid in the bidding process.
•	Obtaining up to date and accurate prices for thermal system materials. 


Requirements and Qualifications
•	Must be able to work on-site at our office in Stamford. 
•	1 – 3 years of construction or architecture experience; insulation/waterproofing systems experience preferred.
•	Basic knowledge of insulation and waterproofing products. 
•	Proficiency in Microsoft Office software.
•	Knowledge and experience using construction estimating software preferred; for example, Bluebeam Revu. 
•	Strong blueprint/plan-reading skills.
•	Solid understanding of basic mathematical principles
•	Stable work history.
•	Highly organized and detail oriented. 
•	Strong problem-solving skills.
•	Excellent time management skills, with adherence to milestones and deadlines.
•	Ability to handle large amounts of data entry and analysis.

Title: Millwork Estimator
column4:
Select NYC Millwork is a high-end millwork and furniture producer in New York City. We are looking for a qualified analytical millwork estimator to join the team. The job entails preparing detailed bid proposals from project plans & specifications. The candidate should be proficient in reading project plans and shop drawings, be highly motivated, detail-oriented and proficient communication. 

Responsibilities

1.	Read, analyze, calculate, interpret, and understand architectural drawings and specification documents.
2.	Review drawings and specifications to determine the scope of work
3.	Generate material take-off lists and costs 
4.	Obtain bids from vendors on specialty items
5.	Prepare job quotes/bids on company’s template 
6.	Follow up on bids as necessary to monitor our pricing compared to our competitors.
7.	Track quotes in CRM software 
8.	Communicate with the client including sending the quote, RFIs, and follow ups. 
9.	Self-motivation with the ability to work unsupervised
10.	Be familiar with cabinet construction and drawing requirements to adhere to the industry's governing bodies (AWI, QCP, LEED, FSC, etc.)

Experience Requirements:

1.	Estimating: 5 years 
2.	Millwork: 3 years 
3.	Computer experience in excel, word, outlook, CAD
4.	Knowledge of woodworking construction techniques
5.	Excellent communication skills
6.	Able to meet deadlines.
7.	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering/ Math or similar preferred
8.	Take-off software skills is a plus
9.	CNC knowledge

Title: Millwork Engineer / CNC Programmer
column4:
Millwork Engineer / CNC Programmer 

Select NYC Millwork is a high-end millwork and furniture producer in New York City. We are looking for an analytical and knowledgeable millwork Engineer to join the team. The job entails interpreting and engineering production drawings for production and installation teams. The candidate should have extensive knowledge of millwork construction and production methods and techniques with an excellent skillset of the design software.  

Responsibilities

1.	Read, analyze, calculate, interpret, and understand architectural drawings and specification documents.
2.	Prepare production ready shop drawings with exact construction and specification details.
3.	Value engineer the project ensuring optimal use of materials, construction methodology, manufacturing and installation to achieve design intent. 
4.	Modifying customers design for functionality and structural integrity
5.	Communicate with the client to approve shop drawings and present the plan to the production team. 
6.	Prepare CNC programs per the project requirements
7.	Work independently to move drawings and CNC operations ahead without supervision
8.	Operate CNC router if/when necessary
9.	Maintain organized CAD files/folders as required


Experience Requirements:

1.	Millwork production: 10 years 
2.	Manufacturing industry experience: 7 years 
3.	Exceptional knowledge of woodworking construction techniques and methods
4.	Excellent knowledge of materials, lighting, fixtures, and hardware.
5.	AutoCAD, Microvellum, Cabinet Vision, Cut Rite, BlueBeam and/or Alpha Cam experience preferred
6.	Computer experience in Excel and Word. 
7.	High level of commercial construction blueprint reading skills preferred
8.	Proficient in programming millwork, casework, and retail fixture parts.
9.	Background in millwork and furniture engineering, 
10.	Proficient knowledge in CNC programming for wood, solid surface and acrylic applications
11.	Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering/ Math or similar preferred
12.	Able to multi-task and meet strict deadlines
13.	Excellent communication skills
14.	Must read, write, and speak English
15.	Self-motivation with the ability to work unsupervised
16.	Be familiar with millwork construction and drawing requirements to adhere to the industry's governing bodies (AWI, QCP, LEED, FSC, etc.)

Title: JUNIOR PROJECT ARCHITECT
column4:
We are currently seeking a Junior Project Architect with a minimum of 2 years experience to join our team.

As a member of our team, you will work with senior staff and the Principal to execute residential projects. You will gain experience in generating designs, presentations and drawings, researching codes, managing schedules, and coordinating with clients, contractors, expeditors, city agencies, vendors, consultants, etc. throughout the entire process of the project from initial client meetings to punch-list closeout. The nature of our business requires immense organization, efficiency, and commitment, but we also maintain a very stable work/life balance.

For 29 years, Joseph Vance Architects has been designing high end, custom residential projects - brownstone/townhouse gut renovations, lofts, rooftop additions and conversions of manufacturing buildings to residential. We are a small group of creative problem solvers with a taste for well-crafted design. We value hard work to continuously grow and evolve, pushing boundaries until a project is the best it can be.

Current projects include a ground up new 6 story townhouse in the Upper West Side (with a new basketball court beneath), a gut renovation of a townhouse in Chelsea including a totally new facade, a 6,000sf triplex in a new West Village development, and others.

Ideally you have experience in residential architecture in NYC, some knowledge of NYC DOB and LPC, have worked with 3D modeling/BIM software and the adobe creative suite. We also expect you to have a great design sensibility and critical thinking skills.

If this sounds like you, then please submit a pdf of your cover letter, resume, and work sample. This is a full time salaried position with medical coverage (no part-time or freelance work). We look forward to hearing from you and appreciate your interest in our firm!

column4:
Highland Associates is a full service architectural, engineering and interior design firm, offering a single source of responsibility for all design and project administration disciplines.  Staff performs: architecture; interior design; facility master planning and programming; HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire protection, and structural engineering; project management; code analysis, site utilization/selection and real estate services.

Currently hiring Entry Level Electrical Engineering to be trained in design of electrical systems for commercial and institutional facilities (new construction, renovation, fit-up and rehabilitation projects, high rise buildings), including, but not limited to: power distribution systems, emergency power generation and uninterruptible power systems, electrical system trouble shooting, lighting control systems; building and site infrastructure upgrades.  Must be proficient in electric circuit and systems design.  Must have knowledge of AutoCAD.  BSEE required.  (No computer majors)
